page.title: 16EMPLOYMENT IN MATHERN.
page.content: We did a survey in our area on employment. We discovered that 75% of the females were fully employed and 100% of the males were fully employed. 36% of the men worked for a public body as did 50% of the women. Private companies employed 33% of the men and 25% of the women. Just over 53% of the males had jobs which were of a managerial nature, but only 16% of the females had any managerial responsibility. The average distance a female travelled to work was 3.5 miles but for men this distance increased to 11 miles. Women spent about 5.7 hours a day at their place of work but men averaged about 9.5 hours at their employment. Most people spent five days a week at work, with an average of 32 days holiday per annum.
